name: Buffalo Cauliflower
description: Buffalo Cauliflower are the perfect vegan game day appetizer - even meat eaters will love them! They are tender on the inside, crispy on the outside, and super spicy. They’re so tasty, it’s almost too good to be true!
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup all purpose flour (see notes for substitutions)
1 1/2 cups panko breadcrumbs (may skip this step if desired)
1 tablespoon pure maple syrup or agave
2 tablespoons unsweetened soy milk, or even water, to thin as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Spray generously with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Spray generously with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and cut cauliflower into bite sized pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash and cut cauliflower into bite sized pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add water, flour, garlic and onion powder, and salt. Whisk until well combined. Place the panko breadcrumbs in a small bowl, if using.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, add water, flour, garlic and onion powder, and salt. Whisk until well combined. Place the panko breadcrumbs in a small bowl, if using.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cauliflower to the batter in the bowl, and toss to combine and really coat the cauliflower. Remove the pieces of cauliflower, one by one, and tap off the excess batter a few times on the side of the bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cauliflower to the batter in the bowl, and toss to combine and really coat the cauliflower. Remove the pieces of cauliflower, one by one, and tap off the excess batter a few times on the side of the bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll each floret in the breadcrumbs to coat, then place on the prepared baking sheet and make sure they are not touching each other, or they will all get stuck together as they bake. Spray the tops with oil, this will help them get super crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll each floret in the breadcrumbs to coat, then place on the prepared baking sheet and make sure they are not touching each other, or they will all get stuck together as they bake. Spray the tops with oil, this will help them get super crispy.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 20 minutes. Flip them over and bake for 15 more minutes, until golden and crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 20 minutes. Flip them over and bake for 15 more minutes, until golden and crispy.

recipeInstructions.text: While the cauliflower are baking, prepare the hot sauce/butter mixture. Melt the butter in a saucepan on the stove over medium heat. Once melted, add the hot sauce, maple syrup or agave and stir. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: While the cauliflower are baking, prepare the hot sauce/butter mixture. Melt the butter in a saucepan on the stove over medium heat. Once melted, add the hot sauce, maple syrup or agave and stir. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the cauliflower have cooked and are crispy, toss the florets with the sauce in a large bowl, then return to the pan. You can serve them immediately, or to make them crispier, put them back in the oven for 15-20 minutes. If you want them super crispy, leave the buffalo sauce on the side for dipping as you go.

You can serve them immediately, or to make them crispier, put them back in the oven for 15-20 minutes. If you want them super crispy, leave the buffalo sauce on the side for dipping as you go.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with easy vegan ranch (recipe included), my cashew based vegan ranch or vegan blue cheese.

itemListElement.text: Add all the ranch ingredients to a medium bowl and whisk until combined. Taste and add salt, if desired, or more herbs. That's it! Enjoy.
